rules: Rule1: If the team uses a tracking collar, then the expedition is successful.
Rule2: Either the team uses a tracking collar or the team operates a drone.
Rule3: Provided that the team identifies a poaching threat, the team protects endangered species.
Rule4: The team identifies a poaching threat or the team reports illegal activity.
Rule5: Provided that the expedition can continue research, then if the team reports illegal activity, the team preserves the ecosystem.
Rule6: If the team has a permit for the national park, then whenever the expedition has funding from a grant, the expedition can continue research.
Rule7: Either the team follows protocol or the team adheres to guidelines.
Rule8: If the team adheres to guidelines, then the team has a permit for the national park.
Rule9: Whenever the team coordinates with authorities, the team assists in enforcement.
Rule10: If the team operates a drone, then the team deploys a camera trap.
Rule11: Whenever the team assists in enforcement, the team supports protection.
Rule12: Provided that the team supports protection, if the team follows protocol, then the team has a permit for the national park.
Rule13: If the expedition receives approval, then under the condition that the expedition has funding from a grant, whenever the team reports illegal activity, the team preserves the ecosystem.
Rule14: The expedition lacks authorization or the expedition receives approval.
Rule15: If the expedition is approved by the government, then it is not the case that the expedition lacks authorization.
Rule16: The team submits an application or the team provides documentation.
Rule17: Whenever the team provides documentation, if the expedition meets requirements, then the expedition is approved by the government.

Rule18: If the committee grants permission, then whenever the authorities review the proposal, provided that the team submits an application, if the expedition meets requirements, the expedition is approved by the government.
Rule19: Either the committee grants permission or the director approves the mission.

Rule20: If the director approves the mission, then provided that the authorities review the proposal, whenever the team submits an application, under the condition that the expedition meets requirements, the expedition is approved by the government.
Rule21: If the team overcomes challenges, then it is not the case that the team encounters obstacles.
Rule22: Provided that the team adapts strategy, the team succeeds in its objectives.
Rule23: The team abandons the expedition or it is not the case that the team fails the mission.
Rule24: If the team persists in its efforts, then the team does not abandon the expedition.
Rule25: Either the team persists in its efforts or the team continues its work.
Rule26: Provided that the team achieves its goals, if the team continues its work, then the team does not abandon the expedition.
Rule27: If the team knows the animal location, then under the condition that the team deploys a camera trap, the expedition is successful.
Rule28: Whenever the team observes animal behavior, provided that the team deploys a camera trap, the expedition is successful.
Rule29: Under the condition that the team analyzes habitat data, either the team knows the animal location or the team observes animal behavior.
Rule30: If the team documents findings, then the team analyzes habitat data.
Rule31: Provided that the team protects endangered species, the expedition is successful.
Rule32: Whenever the team preserves the ecosystem, the expedition is successful.
Rule33: If it is not the case that if the team reports illegal activity then the team preserves the ecosystem, then the team encounters obstacles.
Rule34: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the team reports illegal activity then the team preserves the ecosystem, the team adapts strategy.
Rule35: Whenever it is not the case that the team violates regulations or the team has a permit for the national park, the team faces fines and penalties.
Rule36: Provided that it is not the case that if the team succeeds in its objectives then the team overcomes challenges, the team fails the mission.
facts: Fact1: The expedition has funding from a grant.
Fact2: The team coordinates with authorities.
Fact4: The authorities review the proposal.
Fact5: The team achieves its goals.
Fact7: It is not the case that the team violates regulations.
Fact8: It is not the case that the team faces fines and penalties.
